parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TUDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as TUDTC.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), then concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Tumor Identification category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Tumor/Lesion Identification
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] identification?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Tumor Identification subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the TUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TUSCAT can only be used if there is an TUCAT and it must be a subcategorization of TUCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory Tumor/Lesion Identification
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the sub -category for the [tumor/lesion] identification?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the there are [tumors/lesions] identified. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any tumors were identified.
fields.implementationNotes: This is intended to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing tumor/lesions evaluations are confirmed missing. The sponsor may decide to map "No" responses using the appropriate SDTMIG variables. Typically, this would use the SDTMIG variable, TUOCCUR, with an appropriate TUTEST.
fields.label: Any Tumors/ Lesions Identification
fields.mappingInstructions: Not Submitted.
fields.name: TUYN
fields.questionText: Were any [target/non-target/new/sponsor-defined) [tumors/lesions] identified?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the scan/image/physical exam date used to identify the tumor/lesion using this format (DD-MON-YYYY.
fields.definition: The date of the [examination/procedure] used for tumor/lesion identification, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to identified the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: TUDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the [examination/procedure] used for [tumor/lesion] identification?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUEVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the information?; or Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUEVALID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
fields.implementationNotes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUEVALID
fields.questionText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TULNKID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and the this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor/lesion.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Link ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TULNKID
fields.questionText: What was the [Tumor/Lesion] (link) identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUPRNO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the procedure [ID or Line Number] used to evaluate the tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: The identifier for the procedure used to identify the tumor.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the TU identified and the procedure undergone to identify this tumor/lesion. TUPRNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the TU dataset and records in the PR dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Related Procedure ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the PR domain.
fields.name: TUPRNO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the procedure used to identify this tumor?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used to evaluate/identify the tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: The method used to identify the tumor/lesions. Sponsors may collect the method using a codelist which includes the most commonly known/generally recognized terms. The values will represent the method generically, not the product of the method (e.g., photograph) A sponsor may customize or restrict the list of values per response criteria or protocol needs. At a minimum, the primary method of identification should be entered and is expected to be consistent throughout the study; recording secondary methods is at the discretion of the sponsor.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Method of Identification
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTM Target".
fields.name: TUMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used to [evaluate/identify] the tumor/lesion?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the internal or external identifier assigned to the procedure/method used to identify the tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as image ID number (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound identifier).
fields.implementationNotes: This variable may be used to collect a reference/accession number associated with the method used to identify the tumor/lesion. A sponsor may also decide to use the CDASH variable TUPRNO as an identifier for the procedure.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUREFID
fields.questionText: What was the procedure [reference identifier/accession number]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96783

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUTEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the TU test, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable TUTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TUTEST. The SDTMIG variables TUTESTCD and TUTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: TUTEST
fields.questionText: What was the tumor/lesion Identification test name?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUORRES

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Tumor Identification classification. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Result of the tumor identification (e.g., classification or type of tumor).
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD], for example, TUMERGE, TUSPLIT, TUMIDENT or [TESTCD]_TUORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the TU test code. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUORRES
fields.questionText: What is the [type/classification] of [tumor/lesion] as defined by the criteria being employed?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TULOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location. A location detail text field (TULOCDTL) is conditional for entry (i.e., can be left blank) and allows the study site to specify the lesion in its own terms or can be used to distinguish tumors within the same location if other location qualifiers are not specific enough.
fields.label: Location of the Tumor/Lesion
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TULOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [tumor/lesion] identified?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TULAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the body within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TULAT
fields.questionText: What was the laterality of the anatomical location?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TULOCDTL

fields.completionInstructions: Describe additional detail on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location.
fields.definition: A detail description of the location of the identified tumor/lesion.
fields.implementationNotes: Use if TULOC and TULAT and/or TUDIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified tumors. TULOCDTL is not meant to replace TULOC, TULAT, and/or TUDIR or serve as the free-text description field for TULOC (e.g., Location, Other).
fields.label: TU Identification Location Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPTU dataset as the value of SUPPTU.QVAL where SUPPTU.QNAM="TULOCDTL" and SUPPTU.QLABEL= "TU Identification Location Detail".
fields.name: TULOCDTL
fields.questionText: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field TU.TUNAM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.
fields.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.
fields.label: Tumor/Lesion Identification Vendor Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: TUNAM
fields.questionText: What was the name of the vendor used?
